name: depleted, Earth's
description:
This is 'depleted, Earth's', a new video game from Outhouse Media. In it, players take on the role of a player, who must fend off hordes of minions on an asteroid, before you can reach the final stage.
But, it's not just a face-off – there's a lot more to it than that. All of that leaves you thinking: can you make it to the end? The press release gives you a brief description of the game, which gives you a lot of information besides just the name of the planet in question. The first thing you see is that players will find themselves on the surface of _Enceladus_, the name has been given to this new virtual (gameplay) planet by the ESA, and that it has an energy level of twenty thousand megawatts. It goes on to say that the game has a core mission of collecting minerals. The word mining is used three times and at the end, the press release says: The objective of _Enceladus is to reach the surface of _Enceladus_ and collect blocks from the radar and extract minerals energy through your hands. One red ooze must block the path, while a green slime must protect your face. But wait – there's a clue. It's the planet's water. What? It's the water! Water! Water! It seems that the planet is going
